topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551f230463687247ccb90f00#post_551f230463687247ccb90f00
No.

The best way and most energy efficient way would be to have a portal and one side of the portal moving at regular speed and the other side moving near light speed.  The side that is moving fast if you went through it you would go into the past; the side that is moving slow if you went through it you would go into the future.  Also you wouldn't have to worry about the butterfly effect potentially erasing you either meaning you could travel back before you were born without danger of a paradox.

Pros of portal type time travel:
No paradoxes
Cons:
You couldn't travel before the portal was made.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
